action.action-desc: Mrs. Feinstein (for herself and Mr. Burr) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To require reporting of terrorist activities and the unlawful distribution of information relating to explosives, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Requiring Reporting of Online Terrorist Activity Act.

section.header: Requirement to report terrorist activities and the unlawful distribution of information relating to explosives

subsection.text: Whoever, while engaged in providing an electronic communication service or a remote computing service to the public through a facility or means of interstate or foreign commerce, obtains actual knowledge of any terrorist activity, including the facts or circumstances described in subsection (c), shall, as soon as reasonably possible, provide to the appropriate authorities the facts or circumstances of the alleged terrorist activities.
The Attorney General shall determine the appropriate authorities referred to in subsection (a).

The facts or circumstances described in this subsection, include any facts or circumstances from which there is an apparent violation of section 842(p) of title 18, United States Code, that involves distribution of information relating to explosives, destructive devices, and weapons of mass destruction.
Nothing in this section may be construed to require the provider of an electronic communication service or of a remote computing serviceâ€”

paragraph.text: to monitor any user, subscriber, or customer of that provider; or
to monitor the content of any communication of any person described in paragraph (1).

subsection.text: In this section, the terms electronic communication service and remote computing service have the meaning given those terms in section 2258E of title 18, United States Code (regarding sexual exploitation and other abuse of children).
